column4: I need a little help myself.  For some reason my windows partition which is auto mounted by ubuntu is showing up as two icons on the desktop hda1 and hda1(2) <--- A direct copy of the first link.  Any ideas on how to fix it?
System > Administration > Software Sources
Any one else here dual booting with windows?
Well when my system auto mounts my windows partition its showing two hda1 icons on the desktop one being a copy of the other
- I think they are both windows one of them being the restore partition fat32 - you can change what is mounted on boot with system .  administration . disk s
well when I type mount its only showing /dev/hda1 to /mnt/windows
I don't have a rescue partition
just /dev/hda1 -windows  /dev/hda2 - /   & /dev/hda5 - swap
- hm - i think more information would be helpful because i am lost. - try sudo  fdisk -l l=list
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/23671  I don't know why the swap is showing up twice? in fdisk -l
- It isn't a default install configuration but, a seperate partition was created for /prc - not sure why that is that way.
there is no partition for proc
look at the start and end for the swap
- I don't see what formatting was applied to /hda3 - Is it formatted?
ahh beat me to it.
- grin
it should spit out the fps every 5 seconds or so but if not there is a switch for it.
- seems like the dev dislikes anyone using t as a "benchmark" - keeps the command changing
thats it ty
- would it be safe to script  sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop && sudo shutdown -f now ?
what is -f option?  i've always used -h
is that some sort of force switch?
well I can tell you several websites that won't work properly if thats what you are asking?
someone else having problems with x
